title.narrative: IDOM Advocacy for institutional changes and human rights of the persons within psycho-neurological boarding houses

description.narrative: The main objective of the project is to monitor the respect of human rights in the Moldovan psycho-neurological boarding houses (total number of boarding houses is six, four for adults and two for minors) and to promote awareness and the respect for human rights in these institutions.The project intends to improve human rights situation in the Moldovan psycho-neurological boarding houses by promoting respect for human rights and increasing awareness of the general society and of decision-makers in Moldova o f the situation and a need for changes. During the project implementation a project team will act to challenge practices of abuse of the human rights of persons detained in psycho-neurological boarding houses and train the staff working in the boarding hou ses.During the project the project team conducts 18 monitoring visits into the boarding houses (3 times each) and produce an institution report on each of the institutions. In addition to the monitoring of the human rights situation in the boarding houses the project team will provide legal assistance for 10 significant cases and offer training courses to the nurses working in the institutions. In order to promote changes into the current legislation and practices on mental health the project team brings to gether a working group of experts organise five round table discussions for local public authorities and community leaders as well as a press conference.
